Introduction
USIC_UART_UART001App

Introduction

A universal asynchronous receiver/transmitter(UART), is a type of "asynchronous receiver/transmitter", a piece of computer hardware that translates data between parallel and serial forms.

A UART usually contains the following components:

  • a clock generator, usually a multiple of the bit rate to allow sampling in the middle of a bit period.
  • input and output shift registers
  • transmit/receive control
  • read/write control logic
  • transmit/receive buffers (optional)
  • First-in, first-out (FIFO) buffer memory (optional)

USIC_UART_UART001 App provides non reentrant API to configure the USIC channel and Read/Write APIs/Macros which can be used for achieving a non RTOS use case. Communication may be "full duplex" (both send and receive at the same time) or "half duplex" (devices take turns transmitting and receiving) or "loop back mode" (Output signal is connected to the receiver input of same UART channel).

Scope

App provides non reentrant APIs to achieve a UART communication usecase using a USIC channel.

Abbreviation

  1. UART:Universal Asynchronous Receiver-Transmitter
  2. USIC: Universal Serial Interface Channel
  3. API: Application Program Interface
  4. App: DAVE3 Application
  5. GUI: Graphical User Interface
  6. SW: Software
  7. RTOS: Real Time Operating System

Reference

  1. Device Reference Manual

Limitations

  1. Read/Write functions are non reentrant.
  2. No support for DMA mode.
  3. Fifo buffer is always enabled.
